answers.answer: Hi,I am so happy to learn that you have found relief and that you are on your own to feeling like your own self again.  I am working on that.  I was on Armour for 40 years without problem and in December I started with the heart palpitations and have had my meds decreased three times.  I am waiting for next blood work in about two weeks and hoping that the dose I am on will work or I may feel better if it were decreased.I am writing about the mangosteen juice.  I had a friend who went on that and had miracle results a while back - he had diabetes, I believe.  I haven't asked him about it in ages, but have always been a little curious.  Anything in your research on mangosteen and thyroid?Liz

question: I logged on this site about six weeks ago.  I was diagnosed with Hasimoto.  My TSH levels were 19.17.  I was miserable!  The thing that scared me the worst was the brain fog.  I was always forgetting things.  NO memory.  All the other symtoms were horrible as well...no energy, itchy, bitchy, etc.  we all know what I felt like.The doctor started me on a low dose 50 of synthroid.  In one month my levels dropped to 10.  I am on my way to feel like my own self again.Along with the synthroid I began drinking mangosteen juice.  I believe without the juice I would not feel as good as I do now.   The doctor was also surprised by the blood results.  I have been researching the mangosteen and have come up with amazing information.  For anyone who would like more info contact me.  ***@****
title: I FOUND HELP...
